functional_description: This circuit involves the hypothalamus, amygdala, ventral striatum, insula, and oxytocin pathways. It regulates proximity-seeking behavior, affective trust, emotional safety, and the formation of secure bonds through early and ongoing social experiences.
traits_influenced: Trust, intimacy, emotional security, relational openness, need for connection
symptoms: difficulty forming or maintaining close relationships
example_user_statements: “I get too attached or push people away.”
“I constantly worry about people leaving me.”
“I find it hard to feel truly close to anyone.”
social_environmental_causes: Inconsistent caregiving, early relational trauma, neglect, abandonment, emotional unavailability in key relationships
plasticity_mechanisms: Attachment-related plasticity in limbic-prefrontal systems modulated by co-regulation and emotional attunement. Epigenetic changes in oxytocin receptor gene expression (OXTR) and stress systems like HPA axis can be recalibrated through secure relational experiences.
recommended_interventions: Attachment-informed therapy, emotionally attuned relationships, secure base exploration, affective touch, consistent co-regulation practices
metaphoric_summary: A tether frayed by fear—rewoven with presence, safety, and trust.
cognitive_functions: Relational memory, affect regulation, proximity assessment, social threat appraisal
common_misdiagnoses: Borderline Personality Disorder, Attachment Disorder, Relationship Anxiety

functional_description: Composed of the anterior insula, dorsal anterior cingulate cortex (dACC), and thalamus, this network monitors internal and external stimuli to determine what is relevant. It switches attentional focus between cognitive, emotional, and environmental cues.
traits_influenced: Focus, relevance detection, distractibility, priority setting, situational awareness
example_user_statements: “I’m distracted by everything.”
“I can’t tell what’s important.”
“My attention jumps around without warning.”
social_environmental_causes: Chaotic or overstimulating environments, trauma-induced hypervigilance, underdeveloped attentional training
plasticity_mechanisms: Experience-driven tuning of thalamo-cortical circuits and salience encoding; supported by attentional retraining, mindfulness, and structured engagement. Epigenetic modulation of attention-regulating genes (e.g., DRD4, SNAP25).
recommended_interventions: Mindfulness-based attention training, low-stimulation task environments, structured focus routines, multi-sensory grounding
metaphoric_summary: A spotlight that flickers across everything—trained to shine where it matters most.
cognitive_functions: Salience detection, attentional shifting, sensory filtering, cognitive switching
common_misdiagnoses: ADHD, Sensory Processing Disorder, Anxiety Disorders

functional_description: This circuit includes the auditory cortex, superior temporal gyrus, nucleus accumbens, amygdala, and cerebellum. It decodes rhythm, pitch, and tone, and links auditory patterns to emotional and motivational states through reward and memory systems.
traits_influenced: Auditory memory, emotional resonance, rhythm sensitivity, timing, creative expression through sound
example_user_statements: “Music doesn’t move me like it used to.”
“I can’t keep a beat or sing on key.”
“Certain sounds make me overwhelmed or dissociate.”
social_environmental_causes: Restricted access to music, sensory trauma, auditory overstimulation, neglect of musical play or affective expression
plasticity_mechanisms: Neuroplastic enhancement of auditory-motor-emotional loops via musical training, rhythmic exposure, and expressive engagement. Epigenetic influence on timing and sound-response integration genes (e.g., FOXP2, BDNF).
recommended_interventions: Music therapy, rhythm-based movement, listening to emotionally resonant music, drumming or chanting, vocal improvisation
metaphoric_summary: A soundscape of emotion and pattern—reawakened by rhythm, resonance, and expression.
cognitive_functions: Temporal sequencing, emotional modulation, auditory memory, pattern detection
common_misdiagnoses: Auditory Processing Disorder, Autism Spectrum (music-related sensitivity), Anhedonia

functional_description: This circuit coordinates autonomic nervous system activity via brainstem nuclei, hypothalamus, vagus nerve, and insular cortex. It governs physiological arousal, rest-recovery cycles, and stress resilience.
traits_influenced: Energy balance, heart rate variability, stress tolerance, emotional calm, body rhythm stability
example_user_statements: “I’m always tense, even when I try to relax.”
“My body doesn’t know how to calm down.”
“I feel wired and tired all the time.”
social_environmental_causes: Unpredictable environments, early trauma, lack of co-regulation, overactivation of sympathetic system due to chronic threat
plasticity_mechanisms: Plasticity of vagal tone and parasympathetic recovery; epigenetic regulation of stress axis genes (e.g., CRH, AVP); vagus nerve stimulation and slow-breath training restore autonomic flexibility.
recommended_interventions: Diaphragmatic breathing, cold exposure, polyvagal-informed therapies, safe relational co-regulation, paced yoga or tai chi
metaphoric_summary: Like a nervous system thermostat stuck on high or off—rebalance is possible with breath, rhythm, and safety.
cognitive_functions: Arousal regulation, interoceptive monitoring, emotion-body state integration
common_misdiagnoses: Generalized Anxiety Disorder, Panic Disorder, Chronic Fatigue Syndrome, IBS

functional_description: Centered in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC), parietal cortex, and anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), this circuit supports executive control, working memory, and flexible cognition under variable task demands.
traits_influenced: Cognitive flexibility, problem-solving, working memory, abstract reasoning, mental organization
example_user_statements: “I struggle to stay focused.”
“I lose track of what I’m doing.”
“I can’t seem to organize my thoughts or tasks.”
social_environmental_causes: Cognitive under-stimulation, chronic stress, punishment-based learning environments, overstimulation without integration
plasticity_mechanisms: Experience-driven synaptic pruning and network reorganization in the prefrontal-parietal loop; neuroplasticity enhanced by cognitive load, novel problem-solving, and supportive learning conditions. Epigenetic regulation affects executive function genes (e.g., BDNF, COMT).
recommended_interventions: Cognitive training, structured problem-solving activities, reduced multitasking, mindfulness for attentional control, environments that support exploratory learning
metaphoric_summary: A command center clouded by noise or disuse—reactivated by mental exercise, clarity, and purpose-driven thought.
cognitive_functions: Executive function, working memory, sustained attention, mental flexibility
common_misdiagnoses: ADHD, Executive Dysfunction, Learning Disorders

functional_description: Involves the default mode network, lateral prefrontal cortex, parietal cortex, and hippocampal regions. Facilitates abstract thinking, future simulation, metaphor generation, and integration of meaning across diverse experiences.
traits_influenced: Creativity, abstract reasoning, idea generation, meaning-making, adaptive flexibility
example_user_statements: “I’ve lost my creativity.”
“I struggle to think outside the box.”
“I only see things in black and white.”
social_environmental_causes: Excessive rote learning, suppression of divergent expression, trauma-related thought narrowing, lack of creative modeling
plasticity_mechanisms: Hebbian strengthening across associative networks via narrative, creative problem-solving, and free association. Epigenetic modulation of neurotrophic factors (e.g., BDNF) related to ideational fluency.
recommended_interventions: Metaphor exploration, creative writing/art, symbolic play, divergent thinking tasks, associative thinking exercises
metaphoric_summary: A painter’s palette left dry—revived through color, metaphor, and inner freedom.
cognitive_functions: Abstract reasoning, symbolic mapping, imagination, semantic integration
common_misdiagnoses: Schizoid Traits, Autism Spectrum, Thought Disorder (when misunderstood)

functional_description: This circuit includes the ventral tegmental area (VTA), hippocampus, prefrontal cortex, and nucleus accumbens. It governs intrinsic motivation to seek novelty, explore unknowns, and acquire new knowledge or experiences through dopamine-based reward prediction errors.
traits_influenced: Curiosity, learning drive, exploratory behavior, openness to novelty, information seeking
example_user_statements: “I used to be curious, but now I feel stuck.”
“I’m afraid to try new things.”
“I get bored easily but struggle to start anything.”
social_environmental_causes: Rigid environments, fear-based learning, over-structuring, trauma-related suppression of novelty drive, neglect of spontaneous exploration
plasticity_mechanisms: Dopamine receptor sensitivity and exploratory prediction tuning in reward-memory networks strengthened through safe novelty exposure, curiosity reinforcement, and positive learning feedback. Epigenetic markers modulate learning and exploratory gene expression (e.g., DRD2, BDNF).
recommended_interventions: Playful problem-solving, guided discovery tasks, novel environment immersion, low-pressure learning, curiosity journaling
metaphoric_summary: A spark dimmed by control—rekindled when wonder and choice return.
cognitive_functions: Novelty prediction, reward anticipation, associative learning, uncertainty tolerance
common_misdiagnoses: ADHD (Inattentive), Depression (Apathy subtype), Learning Disorders

functional_description: Involves the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC), anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), and parietal cortex, supporting cognitive control, error monitoring, and behavioral flexibility. Enables adaptive choice-making under changing conditions.
traits_influenced: Self-control, adaptability, cognitive fluidity, rational thinking, behavioral inhibition
example_user_statements: “I freeze when I have to make choices.”
“I always second-guess myself.”
“I get stuck doing things one way, even when it's not working.”
social_environmental_causes: Chaotic or punitive environments, lack of modeled flexibility, rigid rule systems, excessive pressure to 'perform right'
plasticity_mechanisms: Prefrontal-striatal plasticity influenced by dynamic task learning and error processing; modulation of genes related to inhibitory control and attentional shifting (e.g., COMT). Improvement supported by environments encouraging experimentation and safe failure.
recommended_interventions: Decision practice in low-stakes environments, mindfulness, reflective journaling on alternatives, cognitive reappraisal training, flexible role-play scenarios
metaphoric_summary: A compass stuck in one direction—rebalanced through exploration, error, and permission to choose again.
cognitive_functions: Inhibitory control, cognitive flexibility, outcome evaluation, error monitoring
common_misdiagnoses: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD), ADHD, Autism Spectrum Disorder

circuit: Default Mode Network (Self-Referential Thought & Internal Narrative)
functional_description: Anchored in the medial prefrontal cortex, posterior cingulate cortex, precuneus, and angular gyrus, this network governs internally focused cognition including mental time travel, autobiographical reflection, and self-narrative construction.
traits_influenced: Introspection, self-concept, imagination, future planning, moral reasoning
example_user_statements: “I overthink everything.”
“I can’t stop reliving the past or worrying about the future.”
“I don’t know how to describe who I am.”
social_environmental_causes: Unstructured or invalidated self-expression, narrative suppression, developmental disruption of identity formation
plasticity_mechanisms: DMN activity modulated by reflective practices, storytelling, mindfulness, and social validation. Neuroplastic shifts via narrative integration and memory reconsolidation. Epigenetic markers related to memory, stress, and identity maintenance.
recommended_interventions: Narrative journaling, mindfulness of thought patterns, guided self-reflection, constructive autobiographical memory work
metaphoric_summary: A wandering mind lost in thought—anchored through the art of telling one’s true story.
cognitive_functions: Mental time travel, self-evaluation, narrative coherence, abstract reflection
common_misdiagnoses: Major Depressive Disorder, Depersonalization, Maladaptive Daydreaming

functional_description: This circuit encompasses the somatosensory cortex, insula, posterior parietal cortex, and visual association areas. It constructs and updates internal representations of one’s physical body and perceived form in space.
traits_influenced: Body awareness, posture, coordination, physical confidence, visual-spatial self-perception
example_user_statements: “I feel disconnected from my body.”
“I don’t recognize myself in the mirror.”
“I hate how I look or move.”
social_environmental_causes: Body shaming, physical trauma, aesthetic-based judgment, neglect of physical development or self-expression
plasticity_mechanisms: Sensorimotor cortical remapping and insular recalibration via physical activity, touch, and reflective movement. Visual-perceptual integration strengthened by self-directed motor engagement and embodiment practices.
recommended_interventions: Mirror work, expressive movement (e.g., dance), body-based therapy, somatic self-compassion practices, postural awareness training
metaphoric_summary: A living map of the self distorted by shame—realigned through motion, reflection, and reconnection.
cognitive_functions: Body schema representation, spatial awareness, self-perception integration
common_misdiagnoses: Body Dysmorphic Disorder (BDD), Eating Disorders, Somatization Disorders

functional_description: This circuit encodes and retrieves emotionally salient experiences through interactions between the amygdala, hippocampus, and prefrontal cortex. It supports fear learning, emotional tagging of memories, and contextual memory integration.
traits_influenced: Emotional recall, contextual awareness, learning from experience, emotional pattern recognition
example_user_statements: “Memories from the past keep replaying.”
“I can’t stop thinking about painful things that happened.”
“The emotions from past events still feel fresh.”
social_environmental_causes: Trauma, repeated emotional invalidation, high-stress exposure without resolution, lack of safe contextual processing
plasticity_mechanisms: Activity-dependent remodeling of amygdala-hippocampal connections; stress-induced suppression of hippocampal neurogenesis; fear extinction and memory reconsolidation supported by safety and emotional reprocessing. Epigenetic regulation of memory consolidation (e.g., CREB, BDNF).
recommended_interventions: Trauma-informed therapy, memory reconsolidation practices, emotional journaling, expressive arts, narrative reframing in safe settings
metaphoric_summary: An emotional archive where past chapters spill into the present—reorganized through truth-telling, safety, and story repair.
cognitive_functions: Emotional tagging of memory, fear conditioning, contextual memory binding
common_misdiagnoses: PTSD, Complex PTSD, Generalized Anxiety Disorder

functional_description: Bidirectional communication between the amygdala and prefrontal cortex, modulated by the hypothalamus and insula, governing affective salience evaluation and top-down regulation of emotional arousal.
traits_influenced: Emotional reactivity, affective stability, stress sensitivity, impulse modulation, resilience under duress
example_user_statements: “I get overwhelmed easily.”
“My emotions spiral out of control.”
“I feel numb or shut down emotionally.”
social_environmental_causes: Emotional neglect, chronic social threat, invalidation, relational instability
plasticity_mechanisms: HPA axis dysregulation, downregulation of glucocorticoid receptors, synaptic remodeling in medial PFC/amygdala, epigenetic changes to NR3C1 and FKBP5; restoration through safety, validation, and mindfulness.
recommended_interventions: Mindfulness training, somatosensory regulation, therapy for emotional expression, stable relationships, circadian rhythm stabilization
metaphoric_summary: An emotional thermostat set too high from early experience—recalibrated over time through safety and care.
cognitive_functions: Emotion regulation, impulse control, stress appraisal, affect labeling
common_misdiagnoses: Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD), Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD), Bipolar Disorder

functional_description: Relies on mirror neuron systems in the premotor cortex, inferior parietal lobule, anterior insula, and anterior cingulate cortex. This circuit enables spontaneous affective resonance and internal simulation of others’ emotional states.
traits_influenced: Emotional attunement, sensitivity to others, compassion, interpersonal accuracy, nonverbal decoding
example_user_statements: “I feel what others feel, even when I don’t want to.”
“I shut down around strong emotions.”
“People say I misread them.”
social_environmental_causes: Emotional enmeshment, neglect of emotional modeling, chronic invalidation, trauma-induced empathy suppression
plasticity_mechanisms: Mirror neuron activation reinforced through repeated safe attunement and emotional presence; insula sensitivity recalibrated by emotionally rich interaction. Epigenetic shifts in affective bonding hormones (e.g., oxytocin) and stress regulation.
recommended_interventions: Empathic listening exercises, emotional boundaries practice, somatic mirroring awareness, emotion-based role play, intentional co-regulation experiences
metaphoric_summary: An emotional tuning fork that needs to be struck just right—attuned by trust, care, and discernment.
cognitive_functions: Affective mirroring, perspective-taking, emotional simulation, interpersonal decoding
common_misdiagnoses: Autism Spectrum, Highly Sensitive Person (HSP), Codependent Personality Traits

functional_description: Centered in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC), anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), and basal ganglia, this circuit enables planning, prioritization, sustained attention, and initiation of purposeful action.
traits_influenced: Initiative, organization, task follow-through, mental energy, attention control
example_user_statements: “I know what I need to do, but I can’t get started.”
“I get overwhelmed and shut down before I begin.”
“I work in bursts but can’t stay consistent.”
social_environmental_causes: Excessive pressure, chaotic or unstructured environments, learned helplessness, chronic stress inhibiting goal-directed effort
plasticity_mechanisms: Activity-dependent strengthening of prefrontal-striatal pathways; enhanced via structured goal-setting, behavioral activation, and reward expectancy. Dopaminergic tone influences initiation thresholds; epigenetic modulation of effort-reward sensitivity.
recommended_interventions: Micro-tasking, clear reward cues, visual reminders, behavioral scheduling, compassionate productivity tracking
metaphoric_summary: An engine that wants to move but needs a spark—kickstarted by clarity, momentum, and reward alignment.
cognitive_functions: Initiation, sustained attention, goal sequencing, inhibition, working memory
common_misdiagnoses: ADHD (Inattentive Type), Depression, Executive Dysfunction

functional_description: This circuit includes the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC), anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), and medial prefrontal cortex (mPFC). It governs awareness of thoughts, behaviors, errors, and internal states, enabling adaptive behavior and self-guided correction.
traits_influenced: Self-reflection, adaptive control, goal monitoring, insight, internal feedback integration
example_user_statements: “I don’t realize I’m doing something wrong until it’s too late.”
“I struggle to reflect on how I come across.”
“I repeat patterns without knowing why.”
social_environmental_causes: Authoritarian or chaotic environments, lack of modeled reflection, over-reliance on external regulation, invalidation of internal cues
plasticity_mechanisms: Metacognitive capacity enhanced through structured self-reflection, journaling, and error-based learning. Neural tuning of DLPFC-ACC pathways via consistent internal feedback. Epigenetic regulation of attentional and evaluative control genes (e.g., COMT).
recommended_interventions: Daily reflection rituals, behavioral journaling, outcome review routines, internal cue validation, mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT)
metaphoric_summary: An inner dashboard with missing dials—rebuilt by checking in and listening within.
cognitive_functions: Metacognition, error monitoring, internal guidance, attention to internal feedback
common_misdiagnoses: ADHD, Impulse Control Disorders, Executive Dysfunction

functional_description: Mediated by the amygdala, hypothalamus, prefrontal cortex, and hippocampus, this circuit evaluates threat, activates stress responses, and encodes fear-related memory. It regulates acute defensive behavior and chronic vigilance.
traits_influenced: Stress reactivity, threat sensitivity, arousal modulation, vigilance, protective behavior
example_user_statements: “I’m always on edge.”
“I jump at every little thing.”
“I feel like something bad is going to happen all the time.”
social_environmental_causes: Chronic unpredictability, trauma exposure, lack of emotional or physical safety, unsignaled threat experiences
plasticity_mechanisms: HPA axis sensitivity modulated by early-life experience; amygdala-PFC balance shaped by safety exposure and emotion regulation; epigenetic modulation of stress-related genes (e.g., FKBP5, NR3C1) alters stress sensitivity and recovery.
recommended_interventions: Safe exposure to tolerable challenge, stress recovery routines (e.g., breathwork, grounding), secure attachment repair, psychoeducation about fear and physiology
metaphoric_summary: An alarm system stuck on high alert—retrained to recognize when the danger has passed and the body is safe again.
cognitive_functions: Threat detection, emotional salience filtering, physiological arousal regulation
common_misdiagnoses: PTSD, Panic Disorder, Generalized Anxiety Disorder

functional_description: Involves the anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), amygdala, insula, hippocampus, and prefrontal cortex. This circuit governs emotional and physiological responses to loss, enabling mourning, memory consolidation, and eventual reorganization of attachment systems.
traits_influenced: Emotional depth, capacity for love and loss, relational memory, existential meaning-making
symptoms: inability to accept change or loss
example_user_statements: “I can’t move on from the past.”
“Losses feel like they define who I am.”
“I’m scared to connect again after what I’ve lost.”
social_environmental_causes: Unresolved loss, lack of ritual or social support, cultural suppression of grief expression, early attachment trauma
plasticity_mechanisms: Emotional regulation and memory reconsolidation in grief pathways supported through co-regulation, ritual, meaning-making, and affect labeling. Epigenetic regulation of stress-memory circuits (e.g., FKBP5, BDNF) supports emotional integration and healing.
recommended_interventions: Grief-informed therapy, expressive rituals, guided remembrance, meaning reconstruction, support group participation
metaphoric_summary: A heart caught in memory—soothed when grief is shared, named, and honored.
cognitive_functions: Emotional memory, social detachment repair, autobiographical narrative, future reintegration
common_misdiagnoses: Complicated Grief, Depression, PTSD

functional_description: This circuit integrates the enteric nervous system, vagus nerve, insula, and hypothalamic centers. It mediates bidirectional communication between emotional states and gastrointestinal function, influencing mood, appetite, and bodily intuition.
traits_influenced: Appetite regulation, intuitive decision-making, emotional grounding, gut-level awareness
example_user_statements: “I get stomach issues when I’m anxious.”
“My gut feelings are strong but confusing.”
“Eating feels stressful or overwhelming.”
social_environmental_causes: Food insecurity, emotional suppression, chronic stress, relational instability during eating
plasticity_mechanisms: Vagal tone enhancement and gut microbiota modulation influence emotional resilience and digestive health. Epigenetic adaptation of inflammation and nutrient response genes (e.g., IL-6, CRH, gut-derived serotonin transporters) restores regulatory balance.
recommended_interventions: Mindful eating, probiotic support, gut-focused therapy, breathwork for vagal tone, eating in emotionally safe settings
metaphoric_summary: A second brain speaking in sensation—understood when listened to with presence and care.
key_neurotransmitters: Serotonin (90% gut-derived), GABA, cortisol, neuropeptide Y
cognitive_functions: Interoception, emotion regulation, food-reward anticipation, digestive-affective integration
common_misdiagnoses: IBS, Functional GI Disorders, Somatic Anxiety

functional_description: This circuit is anchored in the hypothalamus, pituitary gland, and feedback loops involving adrenal, thyroid, and metabolic hormone-producing systems. It maintains balance in energy availability, hunger, sleep, stress recovery, and metabolic rhythm.
traits_influenced: Energy regulation, metabolic stability, appetite, mood balance, endurance, hormonal resilience
example_user_statements: “I’m always tired no matter how much I sleep.”
“My energy crashes at the wrong times.”
“My mood feels tied to how hungry or stressed I am.”
social_environmental_causes: Chronic stress, undernourishment, overexertion, circadian disruption, attachment deprivation during development
plasticity_mechanisms: Hypothalamic-pituitary axis regulation can be restored through stable sleep, nourishment, stress modulation, and circadian entrainment. Epigenetic changes to hormonal receptor sensitivity and gene expression (e.g., glucocorticoid receptor, leptin signaling) reverse under supportive conditions.
recommended_interventions: Sleep hygiene, nourishing meal rhythm, mindful movement, stress recovery rituals, sunlight exposure, relational security
metaphoric_summary: A thermostat overwhelmed by spikes and droughts—recalibrated through rhythm, rest, and fuel.
key_neurotransmitters: Cortisol, insulin, ghrelin, leptin, thyroid hormones, melatonin
cognitive_functions: Energy appraisal, hunger signaling, hormonal feedback awareness, metabolic prioritization
common_misdiagnoses: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome, Atypical Depression, Endocrine Disorders (e.g., Hypothyroidism)

functional_description: This circuit involves the prefrontal cortex (especially right PFC), amygdala, ventral striatum, and temporal-parietal junction (TPJ). It enables recognition, generation, and social sharing of humor—enhancing emotional regulation, creativity, and relational bonding.
traits_influenced: Playfulness, perspective flexibility, social charm, resilience, emotional lightness
example_user_statements: “I don’t find things funny anymore.”
“Everything feels too heavy for jokes.”
“I want to laugh, but it doesn’t come naturally.”
social_environmental_causes: Excessive seriousness, suppression of play, emotional invalidation, trauma impairing joy recognition or expression
plasticity_mechanisms: Humor-related cognitive-emotional integration enhanced via social laughter, irony exploration, and flexible reappraisal. Reward-motivation network modulation via social joy and positive reframing. Epigenetic factors influencing reward prediction and emotional novelty (e.g., oxytocin/dopamine-related genes).
recommended_interventions: Playful reappraisal, shared laughter, storytelling through humor, comedy journaling, joyful role play, therapeutic humor exposure
metaphoric_summary: A balloon weighed down by sorrow—lifted by levity, perspective, and shared laughter.
cognitive_functions: Perspective shifting, incongruity detection, emotional reappraisal, social mirroring
common_misdiagnoses: Depression, Schizoid Traits, Autism Spectrum (humor-related misunderstanding)

functional_description: This circuit involves the default mode network (DMN), medial prefrontal cortex, hippocampus, and posterior parietal cortex. It enables mental rehearsal of future events, internal scene construction, perspective-switching, and creative envisioning.
traits_influenced: Visualization, perspective-taking, narrative foresight, emotional rehearsal, future planning
example_user_statements: “I can’t picture things in my mind.”
“I don’t know how to imagine the future.”
“My thoughts feel blank unless I’m distracted.”
social_environmental_causes: Concrete or suppressive environments, trauma blocking imagination, lack of reflective play, overstimulating media impairing internal imagery
plasticity_mechanisms: Neural strengthening of hippocampal-prefrontal simulation loops through creative thought exercises, imaginative storytelling, and guided visualization. Epigenetic changes to neurogenesis and attention networks (e.g., BDNF, CREB) foster expanded simulation capacity.
recommended_interventions: Visualization training, guided imagery, future self journaling, daydreaming integration, role-play and scenario rehearsal
metaphoric_summary: A canvas unpainted—filled by imagination when the brush of freedom is returned.
cognitive_functions: Scene construction, episodic future thinking, narrative simulation, mental time travel
common_misdiagnoses: Aphantasia, Depression (low ideation), ASD (concrete thinking traits)

functional_description: This circuit integrates visceral signals from the body with cognitive and emotional interpretation via the insula, anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), and somatosensory cortex. It underlies internal state monitoring, body awareness, and emotional self-awareness.
traits_influenced: Mind-body connection, emotional clarity, internal self-awareness, physical intuition
example_user_statements: “I don’t feel connected to my body.”
“I never notice I’m hungry until I crash.”
“I have trouble figuring out how I feel.”
social_environmental_causes: Chronic invalidation, suppression of emotional expression, trauma-induced dissociation, somatic neglect
plasticity_mechanisms: Plasticity in insular and cingulate networks modulated by mindfulness and somatic focus; epigenetic regulation of interoceptive feedback loops; body-mind practices restore connectivity and precision of internal representation.
recommended_interventions: Body scan meditation, somatic tracking, breath awareness, expressive movement, emotional labeling practices
metaphoric_summary: Like a stethoscope for the soul—muted by silence, reawakened through listening within.
cognitive_functions: Interoception, affect labeling, emotional granularity, somatic awareness
common_misdiagnoses: Alexithymia, Somatic Symptom Disorder, Depersonalization/Derealization Disorder

functional_description: Relies on Broca’s area, Wernicke’s area, the arcuate fasciculus, and connections with the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex. This circuit enables coherent speech production, comprehension, and regulation of inner dialogue, shaping how individuals talk to and about themselves.
traits_influenced: Self-talk style, narrative construction, verbal fluency, metacognition, self-reflection
example_user_statements: “My inner voice is constantly criticizing me.”
“I can’t find the words for how I feel.”
“I repeat negative thoughts in my head all day.”
social_environmental_causes: Verbal invalidation, language-based punishment, exposure to shaming or negative feedback, emotionally suppressed environments
plasticity_mechanisms: Language plasticity through expressive writing, verbal rehearsal, and positive re-narration. Neuroplastic modulation of Broca-Wernicke integration; epigenetic influence via stress-modulated language-related gene expression.
recommended_interventions: Compassionate inner dialogue practices, expressive writing, narrative therapy, metacognitive journaling, nonviolent communication training
metaphoric_summary: An internal narrator stuck on repeat—rewritten through truth, kindness, and choice.
cognitive_functions: Verbal working memory, metacognition, semantic self-labeling, internal narrative generation
common_misdiagnoses: Depression, OCD (ruminative subtype), Selective Mutism, Thought Disorder (when misunderstood)

functional_description: Centered in the striatum, basal ganglia, prefrontal cortex, and motor cortex, this circuit enables procedural learning, habit formation, and behavioral adjustment based on reinforcement and feedback loops.
traits_influenced: Behavioral consistency, habit strength, adaptability to feedback, procedural mastery, self-discipline
symptoms: failure to adapt behavior after mistakes
example_user_statements: “I can’t stick to habits.”
“I keep making the same mistakes.”
“I struggle to learn from my experiences.”
social_environmental_causes: Chaotic environments, inconsistent reinforcement, excessive unpredictability, absence of structure or guidance
plasticity_mechanisms: Plasticity within cortico-striatal-thalamic loops shaped by reward prediction and outcome tracking; dopamine-mediated learning; epigenetic influences on procedural encoding and reinforcement sensitivity. Adaptable through consistent routines and feedback.
recommended_interventions: Daily structure, positive habit loops, goal-linked reinforcement, guided repetition, reflection on progress patterns
metaphoric_summary: A pathway overgrown from neglect—cleared and strengthened each time you walk it with purpose.
cognitive_functions: Procedural memory, reinforcement learning, behavioral conditioning
common_misdiagnoses: ADHD, Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD), Conduct Disorder

functional_description: Involves interaction between the hippocampus, neocortex, and prefrontal cortex to stabilize short-term experiences into long-term memory. It supports contextual learning, knowledge integration, and reflective awareness.
traits_influenced: Long-term recall, reflective thinking, contextual integration, insight formation, autobiographical memory
example_user_statements: “I forget things I just learned.”
“It’s hard for me to hold onto memories.”
“I don’t feel like I’m learning from my experiences.”
social_environmental_causes: Sleep deprivation, emotional chaos, absence of reflection or narrative integration, cognitive overload or suppression
plasticity_mechanisms: LTP (long-term potentiation), hippocampal neurogenesis, and memory consolidation pathways regulated by sleep, novelty, and emotional salience. Cortisol exposure impairs consolidation; epigenetic markers (e.g., CREB) influence memory encoding and stabilization.
recommended_interventions: High-quality sleep, reflective journaling, spaced repetition of meaningful content, emotionally engaging learning, narrative integration practices
metaphoric_summary: A library that can only shelve its books during quiet hours—rest and reflection let the lessons take root.
cognitive_functions: Memory consolidation, long-term retention, contextual learning
common_misdiagnoses: Dissociative Disorders, Mild Cognitive Impairment, ADHD

functional_description: Involves the ventromedial prefrontal cortex (vmPFC), temporoparietal junction (TPJ), and posterior cingulate cortex (PCC). It governs internalization of values, ethical judgment, and social rule adherence through integration of empathy, consequence prediction, and cultural learning.
traits_influenced: Conscience, fairness, guilt, ethical decision-making, prosocial reasoning
example_user_statements: “I always feel guilty, even when I didn’t do anything wrong.”
“I don’t know what’s right or wrong.”
“I get upset when others break the rules.”
social_environmental_causes: Authoritarian or chaotic moral environments, inconsistent consequences, cultural shaming, absence of secure values modeling
plasticity_mechanisms: Plasticity in value representation and perspective-taking networks supported by reflective practice, moral dialogue, and affective storytelling. Epigenetic regulation of serotonin and oxytocin systems linked to ethical sensitivity and prosociality.
recommended_interventions: Reflective ethical discussions, value clarification journaling, empathy-driven storytelling, consequence-mapping exercises, compassionate accountability structures
metaphoric_summary: An internal compass spun by others’ storms—recentered by clarity, dialogue, and connection to values.
cognitive_functions: Perspective-taking, ethical reasoning, consequence simulation, rule abstraction
common_misdiagnoses: OCD (moral subtype), Guilt-based Depression, Conduct Disorders (if underexpressed)

functional_description: Comprises dopaminergic projections from the ventral tegmental area (VTA) to the nucleus accumbens and prefrontal cortex, modulated by the amygdala. Governs reward anticipation, goal-directed behavior, and motivational salience.
traits_influenced: Drive, initiative, reward sensitivity, task persistence, engagement
example_user_statements: “I can’t get myself to do anything, even things I care about.”
“I feel numb and unmotivated.”
“Nothing excites me anymore.”
social_environmental_causes: Inconsistent reinforcement, emotional invalidation, neglect, burnout, achievement-based self-worth
plasticity_mechanisms: Altered dopamine receptor sensitivity and synaptic plasticity within mesocorticolimbic circuitry; stress-related suppression of dopaminergic tone; reactivation possible through positive feedback, achievable goals, and emotionally meaningful tasks.
recommended_interventions: Behavioral activation, structured goal setting, consistent positive reinforcement, gamified routines, emotionally resonant reward design
metaphoric_summary: A spark engine that once ran on hope but sputtered under neglect—rekindled by meaningful fuel and predictable ignition.
cognitive_functions: Goal setting, effort-reward prediction, behavioral initiation, emotional salience encoding
common_misdiagnoses: Depression, ADHD (Inattentive Type), Avolition in Schizophrenia Spectrum

functional_description: Integrates the primary motor cortex, basal ganglia, cerebellum, and spinal cord to initiate, refine, and execute voluntary movement. It facilitates motor learning, postural control, and sensorimotor feedback integration.
traits_influenced: Physical dexterity, balance, coordination, motor learning, somatic awareness
example_user_statements: “I bump into things or drop stuff a lot.”
“I feel clumsy and uncoordinated.”
“I struggle to learn physical skills like dancing or sports.”
social_environmental_causes: Sedentary lifestyle, restricted motor exploration, lack of physical encouragement or skill-building opportunities, trauma-related motor inhibition
plasticity_mechanisms: Use-dependent plasticity in motor cortex and cerebellar circuits; repetition strengthens motor maps; epigenetic changes affect neuromuscular development and motor learning. Enhanced via rhythmic, varied, and feedback-rich movement.
recommended_interventions: Playful physical activity, guided motor skill training, proprioceptive stimulation, dance or martial arts, sensorimotor feedback exercises
metaphoric_summary: A musical instrument that falls out of tune without use—refined with rhythm, repetition, and flow.
cognitive_functions: Motor planning, proprioception, sensorimotor integration
common_misdiagnoses: Developmental Coordination Disorder (DCD), Dyspraxia, ADHD

functional_description: This circuit includes the olfactory bulb, piriform cortex, amygdala, and hippocampus. It directly connects sensory smell input to emotional memory and instinctive behavioral responses, bypassing traditional thalamic filtering.
traits_influenced: Emotional memory recall, intimacy, instinctive behavior, environmental safety detection, sensory nostalgia
example_user_statements: “Smells bring back strong feelings I can’t explain.”
“I avoid certain places because of how they smell.”
“I don’t feel anything from smells anymore.”
social_environmental_causes: Trauma associated with scent, emotional neglect, deprivation of comforting sensory environments, olfactory overload
plasticity_mechanisms: Rewiring of olfactory-limbic associations through intentional scent-emotion pairing and safe re-exposure. Epigenetic regulation of olfactory receptor gene expression (e.g., OR genes) and memory-affective integration genes (e.g., BDNF).
recommended_interventions: Aromatherapy with emotional anchoring, scent-based memory recall exercises, olfactory desensitization, nostalgic scent journaling
metaphoric_summary: A portal to the past hidden in smell—unlocked through presence and emotional anchoring.
cognitive_functions: Emotional memory, sensory association, safety perception, instinctive learning
common_misdiagnoses: PTSD (triggered by scent), Depression (blunted olfaction), Sensory Avoidance in ASD

functional_description: This circuit includes the somatosensory cortex, insula, anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), thalamus, and periaqueductal gray (PAG). It processes physical pain along with its emotional meaning, influencing avoidance behavior and suffering.
traits_influenced: Pain sensitivity, resilience, affective distress tolerance, mind-body integration
symptoms: emotional shutdown in response to pain
example_user_statements: “I feel pain even when nothing’s wrong.”
“My body hurts when I’m stressed.”
“I’ve been in pain for so long I can’t separate it from who I am.”
social_environmental_causes: Early physical trauma, emotional neglect, unsignaled danger, lack of soothing touch, invalidation of pain expression
plasticity_mechanisms: Plasticity in the cortical pain matrix is shaped by pain exposure, coping strategies, and co-regulatory touch. Epigenetic modulation of inflammation and stress pain sensitivity pathways (e.g., IL-6, NR3C1) affects pain threshold and emotional processing.
recommended_interventions: Somatic tracking, safe therapeutic touch, expressive writing about pain, pain-reprocessing therapy, mindfulness-based stress reduction (MBSR)
metaphoric_summary: An internal alarm tuned too high—softened by recognition, touch, and trust.
cognitive_functions: Pain appraisal, affective regulation, sensory integration, interoceptive interpretation
common_misdiagnoses: Somatic Symptom Disorder, Chronic Pain Syndrome, Fibromyalgia

functional_description: Involves the nucleus accumbens, orbitofrontal cortex, ventral tegmental area (VTA), and subcortical motor centers. Supports spontaneous, exploratory, and prosocial play behavior that promotes bonding, learning, and emotional regulation.
traits_influenced: Joyfulness, curiosity, prosocial bonding, creativity, emotional flexibility
example_user_statements: “I don’t know how to have fun anymore.”
“I feel disconnected from joy or silliness.”
“Everything feels serious and heavy.”
social_environmental_causes: Overstructuring, lack of safe play opportunities, performance-based environments, emotional suppression
plasticity_mechanisms: Dopaminergic and opioid-based neural plasticity in response to unstructured social play and joyful exploration; strengthens reward pathways and social-emotional regulation. Epigenetic regulation of play-related reward signaling.
recommended_interventions: Spontaneous movement, laughter-based connection, role-play games, unstructured creative expression, social rituals involving shared joy
metaphoric_summary: A spark of joy buried under structure—rekindled when play is safe and shared.
cognitive_functions: Social mirroring, motor-emotional expression, reward-based learning, flexibility
common_misdiagnoses: Depression, Anhedonia, Autism Spectrum Disorder

functional_description: This circuit includes the somatosensory cortex, cerebellum, parietal lobe, and premotor cortex. It governs unconscious awareness of body position, limb movement, and the sense that the body belongs to oneself.
traits_influenced: Balance, coordination, kinesthetic intelligence, embodied sense of self, physical confidence
example_user_statements: “I don’t feel fully in my body.”
“I’m always bumping into things or dropping stuff.”
“Movement feels disconnected or hard to control.”
social_environmental_causes: Lack of physical play, trauma-induced dissociation, reduced motor feedback, over-reliance on external control
plasticity_mechanisms: Use-dependent plasticity of proprioceptive circuits via movement training, play, and tactile stimulation. Epigenetic regulation of mechanoreceptor function and sensory integration pathways.
recommended_interventions: Balance and coordination training, mindful movement (e.g., yoga, martial arts), dance, body-based therapies, weighted/resistance stimulation
metaphoric_summary: A compass for the body lost to stillness—recalibrated through motion, grounding, and presence.
cognitive_functions: Sensorimotor integration, spatial estimation, limb coordination, motor planning
common_misdiagnoses: Dyspraxia, Sensory Integration Disorder, Dissociative Symptoms

functional_description: This circuit includes the anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), orbitofrontal cortex (OFC), amygdala, and basal ganglia. It monitors potential threats, evaluates outcomes, and regulates inhibitory control in the face of uncertainty or risk.
traits_influenced: Cautiousness, delay of gratification, risk aversion, decision-making under uncertainty
example_user_statements: “I freeze when I have to make a decision.”
“I can’t control my impulses.”
“I avoid anything that feels uncertain.”
social_environmental_causes: Punitive environments, excessive uncertainty, fear-based upbringing, reward inconsistency
plasticity_mechanisms: Circuit tuning through exposure to tolerable risk and outcome predictability. ACC/OFC plasticity strengthened by feedback, behavioral inhibition training, and value-based decision mapping. Epigenetic regulation of serotonin and dopamine signaling pathways affects inhibition thresholds.
recommended_interventions: Graded exposure to challenge, structured decision-making support, impulse-reflection journaling, mindfulness of outcome mapping, low-stakes experimentation
metaphoric_summary: An inner brake that slams or fails—retrained through feedback, trust, and safe risks.
cognitive_functions: Inhibitory control, risk evaluation, uncertainty monitoring, error prediction
common_misdiagnoses: ADHD, OCD, Anxiety Disorders, Avoidant Personality Disorder

functional_description: This circuit involves the default mode network (DMN), medial prefrontal cortex (mPFC), posterior cingulate cortex (PCC), and temporoparietal junction (TPJ). It supports differentiation of self from others, autobiographical memory, and continuity of identity.
traits_influenced: Sense of self, personal boundaries, identity coherence, self-reflection, relational clarity
example_user_statements: “I don’t know who I am.”
“I lose myself in other people’s emotions.”
“I have trouble saying no or protecting my space.”
social_environmental_causes: Boundary violations, emotional enmeshment, identity invalidation, role confusion in early development
plasticity_mechanisms: Plasticity in the DMN and self-processing hubs shaped by narrative formation, boundary practice, and social mirroring. Epigenetic regulation affects self-referential processing and intersubjective integration.
recommended_interventions: Narrative therapy, identity mapping, assertiveness training, mindfulness of self-other distinctions, internal family systems (IFS)-style parts work
metaphoric_summary: A blurred mirror of self—sharpened by story, reflection, and personal truth.
cognitive_functions: Autobiographical memory, perspective-taking, narrative integration, boundary tracking
common_misdiagnoses: Borderline Personality Disorder, Depersonalization Disorder, Codependency

functional_description: This circuit involves the thalamus, prefrontal cortex, reticular activating system, and hippocampus. It modulates which sensory inputs are prioritized or suppressed before reaching conscious awareness, supporting focus and protection from sensory overload.
traits_influenced: Sensory modulation, environmental tolerance, mental clarity, information prioritization
example_user_statements: “I feel overwhelmed in noisy places.”
“I can’t focus when there’s too much going on.”
“My brain doesn’t filter things—it just absorbs everything.”
social_environmental_causes: Chaotic or overstimulating settings, trauma-induced sensory amplification, lack of sensory predictability or regulation
plasticity_mechanisms: Experience-dependent tuning of thalamo-cortical relay pathways and inhibitory control via prefrontal regulation. Epigenetic modulation of sensory gating channels (e.g., CHRNA7) linked to sensory processing sensitivity.
recommended_interventions: Structured sensory environments, rhythmic sensory practices, mindfulness of stimulus impact, gating retraining via graduated exposure and focused attention practices
metaphoric_summary: A mental filter with too many holes or blockages—recalibrated by rhythm, pattern, and protection.
cognitive_functions: Sensory gating, stimulus prioritization, environmental scanning, cognitive load regulation
common_misdiagnoses: ADHD, Sensory Processing Disorder, PTSD

functional_description: This circuit includes the hypothalamus (especially medial preoptic area), amygdala, nucleus accumbens, and brainstem nuclei. It regulates sexual motivation, arousal, mating behavior, and bonding through hormonal and reward-related signaling.
traits_influenced: Sexual desire, arousal regulation, romantic motivation, bonding behaviors, sensual receptivity
example_user_statements: “I feel disconnected from my sexuality.”
“I want intimacy but avoid it.”
“My sexual desire comes and goes without control.”
social_environmental_causes: Sexual trauma, shame-based conditioning, inconsistent sexual messaging, attachment disruption
plasticity_mechanisms: Plasticity in hypothalamic and limbic circuits through safe, attuned sexual/romantic connection; reward reinforcement modulates arousal-reward coupling. Epigenetic regulation of sex hormone receptor expression (e.g., estrogen/testosterone receptors) linked to attachment and sexual development.
recommended_interventions: Safe romantic/sexual expression, sex-positive therapy, body trust practices, mindfulness of arousal cycles, consensual sensual exploration
metaphoric_summary: A flame dimmed by fear or shame—rekindled through safe connection, permission, and self-ownership.
cognitive_functions: Arousal evaluation, bonding anticipation, trust encoding, reward prediction
common_misdiagnoses: Sexual Dysfunction, Hypoactive Sexual Desire Disorder, Compulsive Sexual Behavior

functional_description: Regulated by the suprachiasmatic nucleus (SCN) of the hypothalamus, pineal gland, and brainstem arousal centers. This circuit controls daily biological rhythms, sleep quality, energy cycling, and recovery mechanisms essential for cognitive and emotional regulation.
traits_influenced: Sleep consistency, mental clarity, mood stability, energy levels, emotional resilience
example_user_statements: “I can’t fall asleep or stay asleep.”
“My energy is all over the place.”
“I feel foggy and disconnected during the day.”
social_environmental_causes: Irregular sleep schedule, artificial light exposure, chronic stress, inconsistent routines, trauma-induced arousal dysregulation
plasticity_mechanisms: Regulation of circadian gene expression (e.g., CLOCK, PER, BMAL1) through light exposure, sleep hygiene, and social rhythm alignment. Neuroplastic recovery via melatonin rhythm stabilization and reduction in sleep fragmentation.
recommended_interventions: Consistent sleep-wake routines, light therapy, screen time reduction before bed, relaxation rituals, circadian rhythm alignment techniques
metaphoric_summary: An internal clock thrown off by chaos—reset by rhythm, rest, and light.
cognitive_functions: Arousal regulation, memory consolidation, metabolic regulation, stress recovery
common_misdiagnoses: Insomnia Disorder, Depression, Bipolar Disorder (sleep-related features)

functional_description: Involves integration of social cognition, reward processing, and emotional resonance via mPFC, posterior cingulate cortex, temporoparietal junction, amygdala, and insula. Regulates attachment, empathy, and social bonding.
traits_influenced: Empathy, social intelligence, attachment style, interpersonal warmth, trust
example_user_statements: “I find it hard to connect with people.”
“I don’t trust anyone easily.”
“I often feel alone even when I'm with others.”
social_environmental_causes: Early attachment disruption, chronic rejection, social trauma, lack of emotional mirroring or secure relationships
plasticity_mechanisms: Plasticity in oxytocin receptor distribution and reward pathways; epigenetic modulation of oxytocin signaling (e.g., OXTR gene). Enhanced via nurturing contact, consistent positive social feedback, and secure relational experiences.
recommended_interventions: Engagement in emotionally safe relationships, therapeutic attunement, oxytocin-promoting interactions (touch, eye contact, validation), social rhythm establishment
metaphoric_summary: A social radar that’s been jammed by static—requiring consistent warmth and clarity to tune back into connection.
cognitive_functions: Social cognition, emotional resonance, attachment appraisal, interpersonal theory of mind
common_misdiagnoses: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD), Avoidant Personality Disorder, Social Anxiety Disorder

functional_description: This circuit integrates emotional salience and reward valuation for social stimuli via the mPFC, insula, amygdala, and nucleus accumbens. It underlies social approach, trust formation, cooperation, and affiliative motivation.
traits_influenced: Trust, cooperation, social intuition, responsiveness to others, interpersonal warmth
example_user_statements: “I find it hard to trust people.”
“I avoid social situations.”
“I don't feel connected to anyone.”
social_environmental_causes: Social trauma, chronic invalidation, betrayal, exclusion, or conditional approval environments
plasticity_mechanisms: Plasticity in reward and oxytocinergic circuits driven by consistent prosocial feedback; epigenetic regulation of social neuropeptides (e.g., oxytocin, vasopressin pathways). Reinforced through meaningful and safe relational interactions.
recommended_interventions: Intentional social engagement, secure relational repair, group-based activities with shared goals, oxytocin-boosting interactions (e.g., eye contact, mirroring, touch), therapeutic alliance
metaphoric_summary: A bridge once weakened by broken trust—repaired through repeated steps of safety, recognition, and shared connection.
cognitive_functions: Social reward processing, emotional resonance, social prediction, behavioral mimicry
common_misdiagnoses: Schizoid Personality Disorder, Social Anxiety Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder

functional_description: Involves the medial prefrontal cortex (mPFC), ventral striatum, amygdala, and superior temporal sulcus (STS), facilitating awareness of social rank, self-other comparison, and social acceptance or rejection cues.
traits_influenced: Competitiveness, shame-proneness, self-esteem, social vigilance, validation-seeking
example_user_statements: “I constantly feel like I'm being judged.”
“I don’t speak up—I feel beneath everyone.”
“I tie my value to how well I perform.”
social_environmental_causes: Performance pressure, humiliation, rejection, hierarchical trauma (e.g., bullying, favoritism)
plasticity_mechanisms: Reward circuitry plasticity via social feedback; mPFC modulation through relational safety and role experimentation. Epigenetic regulation of social dominance traits via oxytocin and dopamine pathway genes.
recommended_interventions: Self-compassion training, role reversal exercises, peer validation in egalitarian settings, status-neutral play, expressive arts
metaphoric_summary: A social mirror cracked by comparison—repaired by finding worth beyond ranking.
cognitive_functions: Social appraisal, self-other comparison, status interpretation, relational memory
common_misdiagnoses: Social Anxiety Disorder, Narcissistic Traits, Avoidant Personality Disorder

functional_description: This circuit includes the posterior cingulate cortex (PCC), medial prefrontal cortex (mPFC), temporal-parietal junction (TPJ), and insula. It supports transcendent experiences, existential reflection, interconnectedness, and meaning-making beyond the self.
traits_influenced: Sense of purpose, existential comfort, reverence, compassion, universal belonging
example_user_statements: “I feel disconnected from something greater.”
“Life feels empty or meaningless.”
“I’ve lost my sense of wonder or spiritual feeling.”
social_environmental_causes: Meaning invalidation, oppressive dogma, trauma-induced disconnection, lack of access to awe or mystery
plasticity_mechanisms: Integration of self-transcendent states facilitated by mindfulness, nature immersion, ritual, and symbolic practices. Epigenetic shifts in neuroinflammatory pathways, serotonergic tone, and memory-affect integration (e.g., CREB, SERT genes) support restoration of meaning orientation.
recommended_interventions: Awe journaling, sacred storytelling, guided nature-based meditation, symbolic ritual creation, contemplative practices
metaphoric_summary: A star dimmed by doubt—rekindled when meaning, mystery, and connection are reawakened.
cognitive_functions: Meaning-making, existential awareness, transcendence perception, perspective expansion
common_misdiagnoses: Existential Depression, Dissociation, Depersonalization Disorder

functional_description: Regulated by the amygdala, periaqueductal gray (PAG), insula, and brainstem nuclei, this circuit constantly evaluates whether the environment is safe or dangerous without conscious awareness. It governs implicit defense activation and baseline vigilance.
traits_influenced: Baseline anxiety, safety perception, emotional tone, physiological readiness, reactivity to cues
example_user_statements: “I feel unsafe even when nothing is wrong.”
“I’m always waiting for something bad to happen.”
“I can’t relax around people.”
social_environmental_causes: Unpredictable caregiving, emotional trauma, abuse, sensory overwhelm, social exclusion
plasticity_mechanisms: Amygdala-PFC regulation via safety exposure and co-regulation. Vagal tone improvement supports downregulation of false alarms. Epigenetic adaptation of stress reactivity (e.g., FKBP5, CRH) linked to early-life threat exposure.
recommended_interventions: Safe social contact, rhythmic sensory input (music, movement), eye contact with trusted others, vagus nerve stimulation practices, trauma-informed therapy
metaphoric_summary: A smoke detector that’s too sensitive—calmed by repeated signals that the fire is out.
cognitive_functions: Subconscious threat detection, autonomic priming, emotional salience attribution
common_misdiagnoses: PTSD, Social Anxiety, Panic Disorder

functional_description: This circuit includes the somatosensory cortex, insula, c-tactile (CT) afferents, and limbic regions like the amygdala and hypothalamus. It processes affective touch for emotional bonding, stress reduction, and safety signaling.
traits_influenced: Emotional comfort, trust formation, body-based co-regulation, sensory pleasure, boundary awareness
example_user_statements: “I hate being touched, even by people I care about.”
“Physical affection makes me anxious.”
“I feel numb unless I’m overwhelmed.”
social_environmental_causes: Touch deprivation, trauma involving physical contact, emotional coldness, invalidated bodily boundaries
plasticity_mechanisms: Plasticity of CT afferent pathways and somatosensory-limbic connectivity enhanced by consensual nurturing touch and safe contact exposure. Epigenetic modulation of oxytocin signaling and sensory-limbic interface supports recovery.
recommended_interventions: Therapeutic touch (e.g. massage, weighted blankets), safe physical closeness, boundary-informed touch exposure, affective somatic practices
metaphoric_summary: An emotional skin callused by fear—softened again through trust and gentle presence.
cognitive_functions: Affective sensation decoding, boundary mapping, interpersonal safety detection, tactile emotional integration
common_misdiagnoses: Sensory Processing Disorder, PTSD (touch triggers), Attachment Disorders

functional_description: This circuit involves the parietal lobe, occipital cortex, hippocampus, and dorsal visual stream. It enables orientation, depth perception, object localization, and spatial memory crucial for environmental awareness and bodily navigation.
traits_influenced: Spatial reasoning, body coordination, visual attention, directional memory, situational orientation
example_user_statements: “I get lost easily.”
“I'm bad with directions or distances.”
“My eyes can’t track things well when I move.”
social_environmental_causes: Overreliance on verbal instruction, underexposure to physical exploration, trauma-related dissociation from space or environment
plasticity_mechanisms: Experience-driven growth of dorsal stream networks; neurogenesis and long-term potentiation in hippocampus enhanced by physical exploration, 3D engagement, and sensorimotor integration. Epigenetic regulation of neurodevelopmental pathways linked to visuospatial capacity.
recommended_interventions: Exploratory movement, spatial puzzles, 3D art or design tasks, proprioceptive engagement, virtual or physical navigation games
metaphoric_summary: An internal map missing pages—redrawn through movement, space, and sight.
cognitive_functions: Spatial memory, visual tracking, environmental awareness, motion processing
common_misdiagnoses: Nonverbal Learning Disorder, Dyspraxia, Visual Processing Disorder

functional_description: This circuit includes Broca’s area, motor cortex, brainstem nuclei, insula, and limbic input from the amygdala and anterior cingulate. It coordinates tone, pitch, timing, and affective content of vocal output used in relational signaling and self-expression.
traits_influenced: Expressiveness, prosody, relational signaling, voice tone, verbal timing
example_user_statements: “People say I sound robotic or flat.”
“I don’t know how to show emotion in my voice.”
“I shut down when I try to speak.”
social_environmental_causes: Emotionally suppressed environments, ridicule during expression, social anxiety, neurodevelopmental modulation of prosody
plasticity_mechanisms: Experience-dependent tuning of motor-vocal-emotional integration via feedback, vocal modeling, and emotional mirroring. Epigenetic regulation of emotional vocalization circuits through safe relational engagement.
recommended_interventions: Prosody modeling, vocal tone practice in safe spaces, singing, breath-to-speech integration, expressive dialogue exercises
metaphoric_summary: A musical instrument muted by fear—tuned again through safety and voice freedom.
cognitive_functions: Speech timing, affective prosody encoding, social cue expression, vocal-motor sequencing
common_misdiagnoses: Autism Spectrum Disorder, Selective Mutism, Social Anxiety Disorder

functional_description: nan
traits_influenced: nan
example_user_statements: “I get overwhelmed by loud sounds or bright lights.”
“I don’t notice things others do.”
“Certain sensations make me uncomfortable or shut down.”
social_environmental_causes: nan
plasticity_mechanisms: nan
recommended_interventions: nan
metaphoric_summary: nan
cognitive_functions: Sensory integration, perceptual filtering, salience mapping
common_misdiagnoses: Autism Spectrum Disorder, Sensory Processing Disorder, Anxiety Disorders
